Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: Good evening. From Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia, and welcome to the first, and only, vice presidential debate of 2016, sponsored by the Commission on Presidential Debates.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: I’m Elaine Quijano, anchor at CBSN, and correspondent for CBS News. It’s an honor to moderate this debate between Senator Tim Kaine and Governor Mike Pence. Both are longtime public servants who are also proud fathers of sons serving in the U.S. Marines.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: The campaigns have agreed to the rules of this 90-minute debate. There will be nine different segments covering domestic and foreign policy issues. Each segment will begin with a question to both candidates who will each have two minutes to answer. Then I’ll ask follow-up questions to facilitate a discussion between the candidates. By coin toss, it’s been determined that Senator Kaine will be first to answer the opening question.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: We have an enthusiastic audience tonight. They’ve agreed to only express that enthusiasm once at the end of the debate and right now as we welcome Governor Mike Pence and Senator Tim Kaine. [applause]

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: Gentlemen, welcome. It truly is a privilege to be with both of you tonight.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: I’d like to start with the topic of presidential leadership. Twenty-eight years ago tomorrow night, Lloyd Bentsen said the vice presidential debate was not about the qualifications for the vice presidency, but about how if tragedy should occur, the vice president has to step in without any margin for error, without time for preparation, to take over the responsibility for the biggest job in the world.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: What about your qualities, your skills, and your temperament equip you to step into that role at a moment’s notice? Senator Kaine?

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Elaine, thank you for being here tonight, and, Governor Pence, welcome. It is so great to be back at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: This is a very special place. Sixty-five years ago, a young, courageous woman, Barbara Johns, led a walkout of her high school, Moton High School. She made history by protesting school segregation. She believed our nation was stronger together. And that walkout led to the Brown v. Board of Education decision that moved us down the path toward equality.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: I am so proud to be running with another strong, history-making woman, Hillary Clinton, to be president of the United States. I’m proud because her vision of stronger together, building an economy that works for all, not just those at the top, being safe in the world not only with a strong military, but also strong alliances to battle terrorism and climate change, and also to build a community of respect, just like Barbara Johns tried to do 65 years ago. That’s why I’m so proud to be her running mate.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Hillary told me why she asked me to be her running mate. She said the test of a Clinton administration will not be the signing of a bill or the passage of a bill. It’ll be whether we can make somebody’s life better, whether we can make a classroom better learning environment for schoolkids or teachers, whether we can make a safer — it’s going to be about results.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: And she said to me, you’ve been a missionary and a civil rights lawyer. You’ve been a city councilman and mayor. You’ve been a lieutenant governor and governor and now a U.S. senator. I think you will help me figure out how to govern this nation so that we always keep in mind that the success of the administration is the difference we make in people’s lives.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: And that’s what I bring to the ticket, that experience having served at all levels of government. But my primary role is to be Hillary Clinton’s right-hand person and strong supporter as she puts together the most historic administration possible. And I relish that role. I’m so proud of her.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: I’ll just say this: We trust Hillary Clinton, my wife and I, and we trust her with the most important thing in our life. We have a son deployed overseas in the Marine Corps right now. We trust Hillary Clinton as president and commander-in-chief, but the thought of Donald Trump as commander-in-chief scares us to death.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: Governor Pence?

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: Well, first off, thank you, Elaine, and thank you to — thank you to Norwood University for their wonderful hospitality and the Commission on Presidential Debates. It’s deeply humbling for me to be here, to be surrounded by my — my wonderful family.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: And, Senator Kaine, it’s an honor to be here with you, as well. And I just — I also want to say — I want to say thanks to everyone that’s looking in tonight, who understands what an enormously important time this is in the life of our nation.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: For the last seven-and-a-half years, we’ve seen America’s place in the world weakened. We’ve seen an economy stifled by more taxes, more regulation, a war on coal, and a failing health care reform come to be known as Obamacare, and the American people know that we need to make a change. And so I want to thank all of you for being — being with us tonight.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: I also want to thank Donald Trump for making that call and inviting us to be a part of this ticket. I have to tell you, I’m a — I’m a small-town boy from a place not too different from Farmville. I grew up with a cornfield in my backyard. My grandfather had immigrated to this country when he was about my son’s age. My mom and dad built a — everything that matters in a small town in Southern Indiana. They built a family and — and a good name and a business. And they raised a family. And I dreamed some day of representing my home town in Washington, D.C., but I — honestly, Elaine, I never imagined — never imagined I’d have the opportunity to be governor of the state that I love, let alone be sitting at a table like this in this kind of a position.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: So to answer your question, I would say I — I would hope that if — if the responsibility ever fell to me in this role, that I would meet it with the way that I’m going to meet the responsibility should I be elected vice president of the United States. And that’s to bring a lifetime of experience, a lifetime growing up in a small town, a lifetime where I’ve served in the Congress of the United States, where — where I’ve led a state that works in the great state of Indiana, and whatever other responsibilities might follow from this, I — I would hope and, frankly, I would pray to be able to meet that moment with that — that lifetime of experience.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: Senator Kaine, on the campaign trail, you praised Secretary Clinton’s character, including her commitment to public service, yet 60 percent of voters don’t think she’s trustworthy. Why do so many people distrust her? Is it because they have questions about her e-mails and the Clinton Foundation?

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Elaine, let me tell you why I trust Hillary Clinton. Here’s what people should look at as they look at a public servant. Do they have a passion in their life that showed up before they were in public life? And have they held onto that passion throughout their life, regardless of whether they were in office or not, succeeding or failing?

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Hillary Clinton has that passion. From a time as a kid in a Methodist youth group in the suburbs of Chicago, she has been focused on serving others with a special focus on empowering families and kids. As a civil rights lawyer in the South, with the Children’s Defense Fund, first lady of Arkansas and this country, senator, secretary of state, it’s always been about putting others first. And that’s a sharp contrast with Donald Trump.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia

Speaker: KAINE
Text: Donald Trump always puts himself first. He built a business career, in the words of one of his own campaign staffers, “off the backs of the little guy.” And as a candidate, he started his campaign with a speech where he called Mexicans rapists and criminals, and he has pursued the discredited and really outrageous lie that President Obama wasn’t born in the United States.

Speaker: KAINE

Text: For me, the hardest struggle in my faith life was the Catholic Church is against the death penalty and so am I. But I was governor of a state, and the state law said that there was a death penalty for crimes if the jury determined them to be heinous. And so I had to grapple with that.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: When I was running for governor, I was attacked pretty strongly because of my position on the death penalty. But I looked the voters of Virginia in the eye and said, look, this is my religion. I’m not going to change my religious practice to get one vote, but I know how to take an oath and uphold the law. And if you elect me, I will uphold the law.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: And I was elected, and I did. It was very, very difficult to allow executions to go forward, but in circumstances where I didn’t feel like there was a case for clemency, I told Virginia voters I would uphold the law, and I did.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: That was a real struggle. But I think it is really, really important that those of us who have deep faith lives don’t feel like we could just substitute our own views for everybody else in society, regardless of their views.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: Governor Pence?

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: Well, it’s a wonderful question. And my Christian faith is at the very heart of who I am. I was also raised in a wonderful family of faith. It was a church on Sunday morning and grace before dinner.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: But my Christian faith became real for me when I made a personal decision for Christ when I was a freshman in college. And I’ve tried to live that out however imperfectly every day of my life since. And with my wife at my side, we’ve followed a calling into public service, where we’ve — we’ve tried to — we’ve tried to keep faith with the values that we cherish.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: And with regard to when I struggle, I appreciate, and — and — and — I have a great deal of respect for Senator Kaine’s sincere faith. I truly do.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: That’s shared.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: But for me, I would tell you that for me the sanctity of life proceeds out of the belief that — that ancient principle that — where God says before you were formed in the womb, I knew you, and so for my first time in public life, I sought to stand with great compassion for the sanctity of life.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: The state of Indiana has also sought to make sure that we expand alternatives in health care counseling for women, non-abortion alternatives. I’m also very pleased at the fact we’re well on our way in Indiana to becoming the most pro-adoption state in America. I think if you’re going to be pro-life, you should — you should be pro-adoption.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: But what I can’t understand is with Hillary Clinton and now Senator Kaine at her side is to support a practice like partial-birth abortion. I mean, to hold to the view — and I know Senator Kaine, you hold pro-life views personally — but the very idea that a child that is almost born into the world could still have their life taken from them is just anathema to me.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: And I cannot — I can’t conscience about — about a party that supports that. Or that — I know you’ve historically opposed taxpayer funding of abortion. But Hillary Clinton wants to — wants to repeal the longstanding provision in the law where we said we wouldn’t use taxpayer dollars to fund abortion.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: So for me, my faith informs my life. I try and spend a little time on my knees every day. But it all for me begins with cherishing the dignity, the worth, the value of every human life.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Elaine, this is a fundamental question, a fundamental question. Hillary and I are both people out of religious backgrounds, from Methodist church experience, which was really formative for her as a public servant.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: But we really feel like you should live fully and with enthusiasm the commands of your faith. But it is not the role of the public servant to mandate that for everybody else.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: So let’s talk about abortion and choice. Let’s talk about them. We support Roe v. Wade. We support the constitutional right of American women to consult their own conscience, their own supportive partner, their own minister, but then make their own decision about pregnancy. That’s something we trust American women to do that.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: And we don’t think that women should be punished, as Donald Trump said they should, for making the decision to have an abortion.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Governor Pence wants to repeal Roe v. Wade. He said he wants to put it on the ash heap of history. And we have some young people in the audience who weren’t even born when Roe was decided. This is pretty important. Before Roe v. Wade, states could pass criminal laws to do just that, to punish women if they made the choice to terminate a pregnancy.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: I think you should live your moral values. But the last thing, the very last thing that government should do is have laws that would punish women who make reproductive choices. And that is the fundamental difference between a Clinton-Kaine ticket and a Trump-Pence ticket that wants to punish women who make that choice.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: No, it’s really not. Donald Trump and I would never support legislation that punished women who made the heartbreaking choice to end a pregnancy.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Then why did Donald Trump say that?

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: We just never would.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Why did he say that?

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: Well, look, it’s — look, he’s not a polished politician like you and Hillary Clinton. And so…

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Well, I would admit that’s not a polished…[crosstalk]

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: You know, things don’t always come out exactly the way he means them.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Well, can I say…

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: But I’m telling you what the policy of our administration would be.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Great line from the — great line from the gospel of Matthew. From the fullness of the heart, the mouth speaks.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: Yeah.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: When Donald Trump says women should be punished or Mexicans are rapists and criminals…

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: I’m telling you…

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: … or John McCain is not a hero, he is showing you who he is.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: Senator, you’ve whipped out that Mexican thing again. He — look…

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Can you defend it?

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: There are criminal aliens in this country, Tim, who have come into this country illegally who are perpetrating violence and taking American lives.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: You want to — you want to use a big broad brush against Mexicans on that?

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: He also said and many of them are good people. You keep leaving that out of your quote. And if you want me to go there, I’ll go there.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: But here’s — there is a choice, and it is a choice on life. I couldn’t be more proud to be standing with Donald Trump, who’s standing for the right to life. It’s a principle that — Senator Kaine — and I’m very gentle about this, because I really do respect you — it’s a principle that you embrace.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: And I have appreciated the fact that you’ve supported the Hyde amendment, which bans the use of taxpayer funding for abortion, in the past, but that’s not Hillary Clinton’s view. People need to understand, we can come together as a nation. We can create a culture of life. More and more young people today are embracing life because we know we are — we’re better for it. We can — like Mother Teresa said at that famous national prayer breakfast…

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: This is important —

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: … bring the — let’s welcome the children into our world. There are so many families around the country who can’t have children. We could improve adoption…

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: But, Governor…

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: … so that families that can’t have children can adopt more readily those children from crisis pregnancies.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Governor, why don’t you trust women to make this choice for themselves? We can encourage people to support life. Of course we can. But why don’t you trust women? Why doesn’t Donald Trump trust women to make this choice for themselves?

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: That’s what we ought to be doing in public life. Living our lives of faith or motivation with enthusiasm and excitement, convincing each other, dialoguing with each other about important moral issues of the day…

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: Because there are…

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: … but on fundamental issues of morality, we should let women make their own decisions.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: Because there is — a society can be judged by how it deals with its most vulnerable, the aged, the infirm, the disabled, and the unborn. I believe it with all my heart. And I couldn’t be more proud to be standing with a pro-life candidate in Donald Trump.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: I do have one final question for you both tonight. It has been a divisive campaign. Senator Kaine, if your ticket wins, what specifically are you going to do to unify the country and reassure the people who voted against you?

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: That’s a really important one. That may be the $64,000 question, because it has been a divisive campaign. And again, Hillary is running a campaign about stronger together, and Donald Trump — and this is — this is not directed at this man, except to the extent that he can’t defend Donald Trump — Donald Trump has run a campaign that’s been about one insult after the next.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: But we do have to bring the country together. So here’s what we’ll do. Hillary Clinton was first lady, then senator for eight years and secretary of state. And I served in the Senate. And I’m really amazed, Elaine, as I talk to Republican senators, how well they regard and respect Hillary Clinton.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: She was on the Armed Services Committee. She was on other committees. She worked across the aisle when she was first lady to get the CHIP program passed so that 8 million low-income kids have health insurance in this country, including 150,000 in Indiana.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: She worked across the aisle after 9/11 to get health benefits for the first responders who bravely went into the towers and into the Pentagon. She worked to get benefits for — TRICARE benefits for National Guard members, including Hoosiers and Virginians in the National Guard.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: She has a track record of working across the aisle to make things happen. And, you know, Elaine, I have the same track record. I was a governor of Virginia with two Republican houses. And in the Senate, I have good working relationships across the aisle.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Because I think it’s fine to be a Democrat or Republican or independent, but after Election Day, the goal is work together. And Hillary Clinton has a track record of accomplishment across the aisle that will enable her to do just that when we work with the new Congress in January.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: Governor, how will you unify the country if you win?

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: Well, thank you, Elaine, and thanks for a great discussion…

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: KAINE
Text: Absolutely.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: … tonight. Thank you, Senator.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: This is a very challenging time in the life of our nation. Weakened America’s place in the world after the leadership of Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama on the world stage has been followed by an economy that is truly struggling, stifled by an avalanche of more taxes, more regulation, Obamacare, the war on coal, and the kind of trade deals that have put American workers in the back seat. I think the best way that we can bring people together is through change in Washington, D.C.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: You know, I served in Washington, D.C., for 12 years in the Congress of the United States. And I served with many Republicans and Democrats, men and women of goodwill. The potential is there to really change the direction of this country, but it’s going to take leadership to do it.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: The American people want to see our nation standing tall on the world stage again. They want to see us supporting our military, rebuilding our military, commanding the respect of the world, and they want to see the American economy off to the races again. They want to see an American comeback.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: And Donald Trump’s entire career has been about building. It’s been about — it’s going through hardship just like a businessperson does and finding a way through smarts and ingenuity and resilience to fight forward and — when Donald Trump becomes president of the United States, we’re going to have a stronger America.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: PENCE
Text: When you hear him say he wants to make America great again, when we do that, I truly do believe the American people are going to be standing taller. They’re going to see that real change can happen after decades of just talking about it. And when that happens, the American people are going to stand tall, stand together, and we’ll have the kind of unity that’s been missing for way too long.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: All right, gentlemen, thank you so much.

Title: October 4, 2016 Debate Transcript
Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
Participants: Senator Tim Kaine (D-VA) and Governor Mike Pence (R-IN)
Speaker: QUIJANO
Text: This concludes the vice presidential debate. My thanks to the candidates, the commission, and to you for watching. Please tune in this Sunday for the second presidential debate at Washington University in St. Louis and the final debate on October 19th at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas.

Debate: Vice Presidential Debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia
